thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Taunton girls soccer falls to Milford
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Taunton girls soccer falls to Milford

author: Staff Reports
title: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Taunton girls soccer falls to Milford
text: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Taunton girls soccer falls to Milford Dighton-Rehoboth field hockey blanks Fairhaven By Staff Reports The Taunton Daily Gazette, Taunton, MA By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 11:10 PM Updated at 11:13 PM Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 11:10 PM Updated at 11:13 PM MANSFIELD — The Taunton High girls soccer team lost a tough game to league opponent Milford on Friday, losing 2-1. Abby Small scored the lone goal for the Tigers (5-6-1). Bristol-Plymouth 3 Tri-County 2 The Craftsmen (6-3-2) nipped non-league Tri-County. Lala Marshall scored a pair of goals in the win for B-P. Lindsay Boutin also netted a goal. Brianha Guaradi got the victory in net. The Craftsmen take on Avon Wednesday. BOYS SOCCER Coyle-Cassidy 2 Cardinal Spellman 2 Joey deMello scored with five seconds remaining to give the Warriors (4-3-1) a tie with non-league opponent Cardinal Spellman. C-C goalie Louis Sorrenti, who had eight saves in net, assisted on deMello's goal. Nick Ramos also scored a goal on an assist from JP Ramos. The Warriors host Bristol-Plymouth Tuesday. Fairhaven 2 Dighton-Rehoboth 0 The Falcons (6-4-2; 6-2-2 in SCC) were blanked by league opponent Fairhaven. Jason Berbue had seven saves in net. Matt Stabell and Josh Nunes scored for the Blue Devils. D-R is at Old Rochester Wednesday. FIELD HOCKEY Fairhaven 0 The Falcons (8-2; 8-1 in SCC) blanked league opponent Fairhaven. Erin Kelley scored two goals in the win for D-R. Kylie Fletcher also had an assist. Julia Child collected her fifth shutout in net. Blue Devils goalie Audrey Simmons had 16 saves. The Falcons travel to Somerset Berkley Tuesday. Bridgewater-Raynham 3 New Bedford 1 The Trojans (8-2-1) defeated non-league opponent New Bedford. Katie Swart had two goals for B-R in the win. Kelly Page also scored a goal. Savannah Paige and Katie Swart each collected assists. Hailey Colon was strong in net with 12 saves. The Trojans host Plymouth South Monday at 11 a.m. Apponequet 2 Bourne 1 The Lakers (8-1-1; 8-1 in SCC) beat league opponent Bourne. Hannah Chapman scored two goals in the win for ARHS. Taylor Bulis chipped in with two assists. Katie Little had five saves in net. The Lakers are at Bishop Stang today. GOLF Taunton 208 The Tigers (11-4) lost a heartbreaker to league opponent Mansfield. Mario Wilson led Taunton with a low score of 36. Kaynel Gonsalves (40) and Justin Proto (41) also shot well The Tigers host King Philip Tuesday. Bridgewater-Raynham 116 Durfee 93 The Trojans (9-2) defeated non-league opponent Durfee in a Stableford system match. Connor Anderson led all golfers for B-R with a 25. Other top golfers were Sean Brennan (21), Ben Williams (19), Brett Lowder (18), Sam Taylor (17) and Nolin Williams (16). Page 2 of 2 - The Trojans face Barnstable Tuesday. Coyle-Cassidy 238 Bishop Connolly 290 The Warriors (7-8) beat non-league opponent Bishop Connolly. Kyle Leitch led C-C with a low score of 34. Other top players for the Warriors were Brendan Murphy (35), Pat Arter (38) and Jimmy Ritucci (42). The Warriors face Taunton Wednesday. GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Bridgewater-Raynham 3 Durfee 1 The Trojans (6-5) took three of four matches — 25-22, 25-20, 22-25 and 25-14 — against non-league opponent Durfee. Megan Shaughnessy, Mikayla Morrill, Sierra Sheerin, Natalie Sorrenti, Ashley Rose and Morgan Freiday each played well for B-R in the victory. The Trojans host New Bedford Tuesday. Norton 3 Bellingham 1 The Lancers (4-7) took three of four games — 25-14, 25-18, 21-25 and 25-19 — against league opponent Bellingham. Casey Holmes led the way for Norton with four aces, 12 kill shots and three blocks. Christi Brennan contributed four aces and five kill shots. Molly Barrows finished with a team-high five aces. The Lancers are at Medway Wednesday. Thursday Taunton 3 Milford 1 The Tigers (9-4) defeated league opponent Milford in three straight game — 25-19, 26-24, 21-25 and 25-17 — on Thursday. Co-captain Molly Sullivan had seven digs, two aces and played great defense. Abby Waldron came up big in the second set, getting a kill shot and collecting five service points to seal the come from behind win. By Staff Reports The Taunton Daily Gazette, Taunton, MA By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 11:10 PM Updated at 11:13 PM
